Pros: They have good upper Management.
Cons: The people who are promoted to middle management positions are running the show and they do not respect their fellow Associates. Our line has been trying to get this one person removed for disrespecting everyone and HR doesn't help any of us. The jobs get harder every year as they try to consolidate. Starting here is difficult as you will be forced to work nights for your first 5 years after you get hired on as a contract worker. It also takes a minimum of 1 year to be hired on as a BMW Associates. Your looking at probably around 7 years of night shift work before getting anything good from them.

Pros: Depending on the dealership network you work for your commission structure will differ. The more complicated, the more it’s designed to hold you back. However, with a good commission structure, ambition and willingness to be learn, you can earn a very good income. The job is what you make it, you run your own show and build your own clientele base. Some people need structure to be successful and others strive when left to their own devices so this job isn’t for everyone.
Cons: Most dealership networks don’t offer any in depth, continuous training. It is sink or swim unless you seek out help yourself. Most sales managers and peers will offer help and their know how when asked.

Pros: High pay because that is only way to keep people working there. If other companies paid more then no one would work there.
Cons: Management is the worst. They have no leadership skills. They constantly lie to you about everything. They create rules and then selectively enforce them. Very management heavy. I had 10 supervisors. No communications between anyone. No quality control on products. Management doesnt care about anything but number of cars out the door. No overtime allowed except for certain people who dont work but spend all their time in office with managers. Maintenance is expected to do 6 people's job at same pay. Management only let's certain people do certain things so if you want to do anything then learn to suck up to all your bosses. They are hiring new technicians that have just completed school and are trying to force out the older, higher payer technicians.

Pros: Great pay and lots of days off!
Cons: The hours are very long.
